Hemoglobin.description: Hemoglobin carries oxygen in your blood.

WBC.description: White blood cells help your body fight infection.

RBC.description: Red blood cells carry oxygen throughout your body.

Platelets.description: Platelets help blood clot and prevent bleeding.

Glucose.description: Fasting glucose measures blood sugar level.

Total Cholesterol.description: Total cholesterol reflects overall blood lipid balance.

HDL.description: HDL is often called good cholesterol.

LDL.description: LDL is often called bad cholesterol.

Triglycerides.description: High triglycerides can increase heart risk over time.

VLDL.description: VLDL carries triglycerides in blood and helps estimate lipid risk.

Non-HDL Cholesterol.description: Non-HDL cholesterol reflects all potentially harmful cholesterol particles.

Vitamin D.description: Vitamin D is important for bone and immune health.
